channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: 310 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore, including 7 in the community and 6 imported
item.description:
July 22, 2020 3:24 PM

The community cases comprise three Singaporeans or permanent residents and four work pass holders.

item.title: More than half of Singapore's hotel rooms used in Covid-19 battle, not all can reopen for staycations: STB chief
item.description:
July 22, 2020 3:00 PM

The hotels rooms are being used as isolation and quarantine facilities, as well as accommodations for returning residents serving their 14-day stay-home notice.

item.title: Staycation deals, heartland tours part of $45m domestic tourism campaign to save local businesses
item.description:
July 22, 2020 3:00 PM

There are packages and deals for locals, heartland tours and the promotion of precincts as mini-holiday destinations through a wide range of tie-ups.

item.title: Coronavirus: 8 among group of 18 charged over meeting up during circuit breaker period
item.description:
July 22, 2020 2:38 PM

SINGAPORE - Eight people among a group of 18 who met up in a flat in Compassvale Crescent during the circuit breaker period were charged in court on Wednesday (July 22) with breaching Covid-19 restrictions.

item.title: National Day Istana Open House on Aug 2 to be held virtually
item.description:
July 22, 2020 1:47 PM

The hour-long event will be hosted on President Halimah Yacob's Facebook and Instagram platforms.

item.title: 4 men charged with corruption in construction of Customs Operations Command building
item.description:
July 22, 2020 12:59 PM

SINGAPORE - A resident technical officer was allegedly paid close to $5,320 in overtime work in exchange for leniency with the inspections of the mechanical construction works in the Customs Operations Command complex.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on July 22
Coronavirus: 28 to be charged with flouting rules on social gatherings
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

In two separate cases, 28 people will be charged in court with flouting safe distancing regulations by holding and attending social gatherings, said the police in statements yesterday.

item.title: Veteran a strong believer in research, continuing education
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Dr Alice Chua believes that nurses are in the best position to effect transformation in their patients' journey to recovery, and research and continuing education are needed to address patients' changing needs.

item.title: Coronavirus: How rules on social gatherings have changed since circuit breaker
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Social gatherings were banned under circuit breaker rules to curb the spread of Covid-19. The ban continued in phase one of the economic reopening, but was eased with phase two on June 19. Here is a look at how the rules have changed:

item.title: Passion for training and mentoring young colleagues
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Realising that elderly residents at nursing homes were particularly vulnerable to Covid-19, Ms Tay Yee Kian stepped up to train community nurses to better care for them.

item.title: Coronavirus: Average number of new community cases daily falls to 10
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

The average number of new daily coronavirus patients in the community has been steadily falling, with yesterday being the eighth day in a row that the figure has decreased.

item.title: Her mantra: Make things safer, faster and better for patients
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Ms Kala Narayanasamy's mantra in nursing is to ask herself how she can make things "safer, faster and better" for her patients.

item.title: Singapore's largest dormitory with 16,000 workers cleared of coronavirus
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore's biggest dormitory for migrant workers has been declared free of the coronavirus after it had recorded one of the earliest and largest clusters among dorms.

item.title: She accompanies dying patients in their last moments
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Nursing director Chin Soh Mun has pretty much seen it all in her 48 years in the profession, in roles ranging from acute to long-term care, but she has now found her true calling - palliative care at the Dover Park Hospice.

item.title: MHA to review penalty framework in cases similar to that of NUS student
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) will review the penalty framework in cases similar to the recent one involving a dentistry student who tried to strangle his former girlfriend and pressed his thumb against her eye after she rejected him.

item.title: Woman jailed 8 months over unauthorised ez-link top-ups
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

A part-time supermarket cashier copied the bank card details of 34 customers into a notebook and used the information to make 1,011 unauthorised ez-link top-up transactions totalling $41,330.

item.title: PAP Women's Wing and Aware express dismay over 'disproportionate' sentence
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

The People's Action Party (PAP) Women's Wing and Association of Women for Action and Research (Aware) have said they are dismayed at the sentence that the National University of Singapore (NUS) student received for trying to strangle his former girlfriend.

item.title: Woman fined over illegal supply of goods to North Korea
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

A secretary was aware that her Singapore-based firm and related companies were unlawfully supplying luxury items to North Korea but she failed to alert the authorities as she feared losing her job.

item.title: Racial Harmony Day underscores need for better understanding of diversity
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Differences in cultures and backgrounds will always exist in an urbanised society like Singapore, and there is a need to continue having discussions about race and diversity beyond Racial Harmony Day, Ambassador-at-Large Ong Keng Yong said yesterday.

item.title: 3 men arrested, several drugs seized in CNB operation
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 300g of ketamine was found hidden in a coconut during an operation yesterday in which the authorities seized more than $66,000 worth of drugs.

item.title: Five nurses get highest honour for outstanding work
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Five persons received the President's Award for Nurses this year for their outstanding performance and contributions: (clockwise from bottom left) Ms Kala Narayanasamy, 59, Woodlands Health Campus' deputy director of nursing; Ms Patricia Yong, 56, Singapore General Hospital deputy director of nursing; Dr Alice Chua, 44, assistant director of nursing and advanced practice nurse at National Cancer Centre Singapore; Ms Chin Soh Mun, 66, director of nursing at Dover Park Hospice; and Ms Tay Yee Kian, 51, assistant director of nursing and advanced practice nurse at National University Health System. They each received a trophy, a certificate signed by President Halimah Yacob and a $10,000 cash prize that can be used for professional and personal development.

item.title: BCA to get new CEO in Nov as it oversees an industry in transition
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Come Nov 2, the Building and Construction Authority (BCA), which has gained new importance as the go-to agency for construction firms amid Covid-19, will have a new chief executive officer.

item.title: Trials for three Covid-19 vaccines show promise but much more work still needed, say experts
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

The fight against Covid-19 received a boost this week with the release of findings from human trials of three vaccines, including one being developed by Oxford University.

item.title: ERP charge of $1 at three CTE gantries from next Monday
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Motorists driving past three gantries on the Central Expressway (CTE) during morning and evening peak hours will have to pay Electronic Road Pricing (ERP) fees again from next Monday after enjoying a three-month reprieve.

item.title: Coronavirus: Duke-NUS, Arcturus get nod for clinical trials in Singapore
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

A vaccine jointly developed by Duke-NUS Medical School and United States pharmaceutical company Arcturus Therapeutics has received approval for clinical trials.

item.title: Publisher recalls children's book deemed 'racist'
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Publisher Marshall Cavendish Education has apologised to readers for causing any misunderstanding after a complaint surfaced that a Chinese-language children's book it published is racist.

item.title: Coronavirus: Over 80 hotels get nod for staycations with strict safeguards
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 80 hotels have been approved for staycations, the Singapore Tourism Board (STB) said yesterday.

item.title: Approach to ICU preparation bears fruit amid Covid-19
item.description:
July 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Six years ago, Ms Patricia Yong started cross-training intensive care unit (ICU) nurses in Singapore General Hospital (SGH). She would rotate them every three months from the intermediate care area and high dependency units to ICUs, and from one ICU to another.

item.title: Navigating an increasingly complex environment through the lens of politics and policy
